title: Authors and Citation
text: Ricardo Semião. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Semião R (2024). varr: Utility Functions VAR Analisys. https://https://github.com/ricardo-semiao/varr, https://ricardo-semiao.github.io/varr/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {varr: Utility Functions for VAR Analisys},   author = {Ricardo Semião},   year = {2024},   note = {https://https://github.com/ricardo-semiao/varr, https://ricardo-semiao.github.io/varr/}, }

title: Utility Functions for VAR Analisys
text: varr R package developed provide general utility functions projects involving Vector Auto-Regressive models, specifically vars package. Disclaimer: package early stage life. hasn’t thoroughly tested can present several bugs. don’t recommend using large-scale projects, yet. Please report problems email () github issue. Thank ! Author: Ricardo Semião e Castro (ricardo.semiao@outlook).

title: Utility Functions for VAR Analisys
text: Mainly, functions retrieve results vars objects, manipulate tidyverse, plot commonly needed ggplot graphs, realm IRF’s, FEVD’s, predict graphs, VAR series residual analysis. future, intent add functions quick (thorough) analysis retrieval trends, seasonality, structural breaks, using common methods statistical tests. Additionally, want expand package VAR-like objects.

title: Utility Functions for VAR Analisys
text: can install development version varr GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("ricardo-semiao/varr")

title: Utility Functions for VAR Analisys
text: Specially “setup” suite, vardiff package. Specify hat errors expect expect_error calls. Directly test elements ggplots returned functions. tests specifically test_fun(). Add tests “helper” “setup” functions. Rethink test functions list scheme. Change “args_…” “…_args” arguments names Change “serie(s)” naming “var(s)” “col(s)” Change names internal faceting variables Give hints work results. Direct used methods like “see: ?vars:::predict”. Additional: Add package data custom examples Solve less important lintr notes. Study importing whole rlang ggplot2.

title: Utility Functions for VAR Analisys
text: package: Using styler lintr packages style consistency. Uses testthat vdiffr automate tests. Uses rlang frameworks tidy eval rlang errors.

what: Plot autocorrelation (and similars) of dataset — ggvar_acf
title: Plot autocorrelation (and similars) of dataset — ggvar_acf
text: ggvar_acf plots auto-correlations (similars) call every series, using facet_wrap. ggvar_ccf plots cross-correlations (similars) series, grid.

title: Plot autocorrelation (and similars) of dataset — ggvar_acf
code: ggvar_acf(   x,   series = NULL,   lag.max = NULL,   type = "correlation",   graph_type = "segment",   args_geom = list(),   args_ribbon = list(linetype = 2, color = "blue", fill = NA),   args_hline = list(),   args_facet = list(),   ci = 0.95,   ... )  ggvar_ccf(   x,   series = NULL,   lag.max = NULL,   type = "correlation",   graph_type = "segment",   args_geom = list(),   args_ribbon = list(linetype = 2, color = "blue", fill = NA),   args_hline = list(),   args_facet = list(),   facet_type = "ggplot",   ci = 0.95,   ... )

title: Plot autocorrelation (and similars) of dataset — ggvar_acf
text: x dataset (object coercible data.frame) "varest" object get residuals . series character vector series (column names) consider. Defaults (NULL). lag.max number lags used calculate ACF, passed acf. type type ACF computed. Can either "correlation", "covariance", "partial". Passed acf. graph_type ggplot geom used create plot: 'segment', ggplot2::geom_segment 'area', ggplot2::geom_area. args_geom Arguments passed chosen 'geom'. args_ribbon Additional arguments passed ggplot2::geom_ribbon. args_hline Additional arguments passed ggplot2::geom_hline. args_facet Additional arguments passed faceting engine used. ci level confidence ACF confidence interval. Set FALSE omit geom_ribbon. ... Arguments passed varr:::setup_acf_setup varr:::setup_ccf_setup, generic function formats x 'graphable' format. Use created method unsupported class x.Pass additional arguments stats::acf . facet_type facet 'engine' used. 'ggplot2' ggplot2::facet_grid, 'ggh4x' ggh4x::facet_grid2.

title: Plot autocorrelation (and similars) of dataset — ggvar_acf
text: object class 'ggplot'.

title: Plot autocorrelation (and similars) of dataset — ggvar_acf
code: ggvar_acf(freeny[-2], args_facet = list(scales = "free_y"))  ggvar_ccf(freeny[-2], args_facet = list(scales = "free_y")) #> Error in ggvar_ccf(freeny[-2], args_facet = list(scales = "free_y")): could not find function "ggvar_ccf" ggvar_acf(vars::VAR(freeny[-2]), args_facet = list(scales = "free_y"))

title: Plot VAR Residuals Dispersion — ggvar_dispersion
text: Plots scatterplot residuals versus fitted values VAR model, using ggplot2.

title: Plot VAR Residuals Dispersion — ggvar_dispersion
code: ggvar_dispersion(   x,   series = NULL,   args_point = list(),   args_hline = list(),   args_facet = list(),   ... )

title: Plot VAR Residuals Dispersion — ggvar_dispersion
text: x "varest" object get residuals fitted values . series character vector series (column names) consider. Defaults (NULL). args_point Additional arguments passed ggplot2::geom_point. args_hline Additional arguments passed ggplot2::geom_hline. args_facet Additional arguments passed faceting engine used. ... Arguments passed varr:::dispersion_setup, generic function formats x 'graphable' format. Use created method unsupported class x.

title: Plot VAR Residuals Dispersion — ggvar_dispersion
text: object class 'ggplot'.

title: Plot VAR Residuals Dispersion — ggvar_dispersion
code: ggvar_dispersion(vars::VAR(freeny[-2]), args_facet = list(scales = "free_x"))

title: Plot VAR Residuals Distribution — ggvar_dist
text: Plots histogram residuals VAR model, overlayed normal curve.

title: Plot VAR Residuals Distribution — ggvar_dist
code: ggvar_dist(   x,   series = NULL,   bins = 30,   palette = c("grey", "black"),   size = 1,   ... )

title: Plot VAR Residuals Distribution — ggvar_dist
text: x "varest" object. series character vector variables consider. Defaults (NULL). bins interger. number histogram bins, passed geom_histogram. palette vector colors (bins, normal curve). See vignette("palettes"). size interger. size normal curve line, passed geom_line. ... Aditional arguments passed geom_histogram.

title: Plot VAR Residuals Distribution — ggvar_dist
text: object class ggplot.

title: Plot VAR Residuals Distribution — ggvar_dist
code: ggvar_dist(vars::VAR(EuStockMarkets))

title: Plot VAR Residuals Distribution — ggvar_distribution
text: Plots histogram residuals VAR model, variables dataset, possibly overlapped normal curve.

title: Plot VAR Residuals Distribution — ggvar_distribution
code: ggvar_distribution(   x,   series = NULL,   plot_normal = TRUE,   args_histogram = list(bins = 30),   args_line = list(),   args_facet = list(),   ... )

title: Plot VAR Residuals Distribution — ggvar_distribution
text: x Either "varest" object plotting residuals, dataset (object coercible data.frame) numeric variables. series character vector series (column names) consider. Defaults (NULL). plot_normal Logical, whether normal curve plotted. args_histogram Additional arguments passed ggplot2::geom_histogram. args_line Additional arguments passed ggplot2::geom_line. args_facet Additional arguments passed faceting engine used. ... Arguments passed varr:::distribution_setup, generic function formats x 'graphable' format. Use created method unsupported class x.

title: Plot VAR Residuals Distribution — ggvar_distribution
text: object class 'ggplot'.

title: Plot VAR Residuals Distribution — ggvar_distribution
code: ggvar_distribution(vars::VAR(freeny[-2]))

what: Plot for Forecast Error Variance Decomposition of a VAR — ggvar_fevd
title: Plot for Forecast Error Variance Decomposition of a VAR — ggvar_fevd
text: Plots result fevd call.

title: Plot for Forecast Error Variance Decomposition of a VAR — ggvar_fevd
code: ggvar_fevd(   x,   series = NULL,   n.ahead = NULL,   graph_type = "bar",   args_geom = list(),   args_facet = list(),   args_point = list(),   colors = NULL,   ... )

title: Plot for Forecast Error Variance Decomposition of a VAR — ggvar_fevd
text: x "varest" object pass fevd, , directly, "varfevd" object. series character vector series (column names) consider. Defaults (NULL). n.ahead integer. size forecast horizon, passed fevd. Unused x "varfevd" object. graph_type ggplot geom used create plot: 'segment', ggplot2::geom_segment, 'area', ggplot2::geom_area, 'line', ggplot2::geom_line. args_geom Arguments passed chosen 'geom'. args_facet Additional arguments passed faceting engine used. args_point Additional arguments passed ggplot2::geom_point. colors vector colors 'geoms' /variables. See vignette('colors'). ... Arguments passed varr:::fevd_setup, generic function formats x 'graphable' format. Use created method unsupported class x.Pass additional arguments vars::fevd .

title: Plot for Forecast Error Variance Decomposition of a VAR — ggvar_fevd
text: object class 'ggplot'.

title: Plot for Forecast Error Variance Decomposition of a VAR — ggvar_fevd
code: ggvar_fevd(vars::VAR(freeny[-2]), n.ahead = 10)

title: Plot VAR Fitted Values — ggvar_fit
text: Plots fitted values VAR model, versus actual values. ggvar_fit Plots serie facet. ggvar_fit_colored plots graph, different color.

title: Plot VAR Fitted Values — ggvar_fit
code: ggvar_fit(   x,   series = NULL,   index = NULL,   args_line = list(),   args_facet = list(),   ... )

title: Plot VAR Fitted Values — ggvar_fit
text: x "varest" object get fitted values . series character vector series (column names) consider. Defaults (NULL). index vector labels x-axis, normally dates. Must length equal x$obs. Defaults integer sequence. args_line Additional arguments passed ggplot2::geom_line. args_facet Additional arguments passed faceting engine used. ... Arguments passed varr:::fit_setup, generic function formats x 'graphable' format. Use created method unsupported class x.

title: Plot VAR Fitted Values — ggvar_fit
text: object class 'ggplot'.

title: Plot VAR Fitted Values — ggvar_fit
code: x <- vars::VAR(freeny[-2]) ggvar_fit(x, args_facet = list(scales = "free_y"))

what: Plot Values of Dataset or VAR Residuals — ggvar_history
title: Plot Values of Dataset or VAR Residuals — ggvar_history
text: Plots historic values variables dataset, residuals VAR model. ggvar_values Plots series facet. ggvar_values_colored plots graph, different color.

title: Plot Values of Dataset or VAR Residuals — ggvar_history
code: ggvar_history(   x,   series = NULL,   index = NULL,   graph_type = "faceted",   args_line = list(),   args_facet = list(),   colors = NULL,   ... )

title: Plot Values of Dataset or VAR Residuals — ggvar_history
text: x Either "varest" object plotting residuals, dataset (object coercible data.frame) numeric variables. series character vector series (column names) consider. Defaults (NULL). index vector labels x-axis, normally dates. Must length equal x$obs nrow(x). Defaults integer sequence. graph_type type plot, 'faceted' 'colored'. args_line Additional arguments passed ggplot2::geom_line. args_facet Additional arguments passed faceting engine used. colors vector colors 'geoms' /variables. See vignette('colors'). ... Arguments passed varr:::history_setup, generic function formats x 'graphable' format. Use created method unsupported class x.

title: Plot Values of Dataset or VAR Residuals — ggvar_history
text: object class 'ggplot'.

title: Plot Values of Dataset or VAR Residuals — ggvar_history
code: ggvar_history(freeny[-2], args_facet = list(scales = "free_y")) #> Error in ggvar_history(freeny[-2], args_facet = list(scales = "free_y")): could not find function "ggvar_history" ggvar_history(vars::VAR(freeny[-2]), args_facet = list(scales = "free_y")) #> Error in ggvar_history(vars::VAR(freeny[-2]), args_facet = list(scales = "free_y")): could not find function "ggvar_history"

what: Plot Impulse Response Functions of a VAR — ggvar_irf
title: Plot Impulse Response Functions of a VAR — ggvar_irf
text: Plots result irf call.

title: Plot Impulse Response Functions of a VAR — ggvar_irf
code: ggvar_irf(   x,   series_imp = NULL,   series_resp = NULL,   n.ahead = 10,   ci = 0.95,   args_line = list(),   args_hline = list(),   args_ribbon = list(fill = NA, linetype = 2, color = "blue"),   args_facet = list(),   facet_type = "ggplot",   ... )

title: Plot Impulse Response Functions of a VAR — ggvar_irf
text: x "varest" object pass irf, , directly, "varirf" object. series_imp character vector variables consider impulses. Defaults (NULL). series_resp character vector variables consider responses. Defaults (NULL). n.ahead integer. size forecast horizon, passed irf. Unused x "varirf". ci level confidence irf. Set FALSE omit. args_line Additional arguments passed ggplot2::geom_line. args_hline Additional arguments passed ggplot2::geom_hline. args_ribbon Additional arguments passed ggplot2::geom_ribbon. args_facet Additional arguments passed faceting engine used. facet_type facet 'engine' used. 'ggplot2' ggplot2::facet_grid, 'ggh4x' ggh4x::facet_grid2. ... Arguments passed varr:::irf_setup, generic function formats x 'graphable' format. Use created method unsupported class x.Pass additional arguments vars::irf .

title: Plot Impulse Response Functions of a VAR — ggvar_irf
text: object class 'ggplot'.

title: Plot Impulse Response Functions of a VAR — ggvar_irf
code: ggvar_irf(vars::VAR(freeny[-2]), args_facet = list(scales = "free_y")) #> Error in setup_ggvar_irf(x, n.ahead, series_impulse, series_response,     ci, facet): `n.ahead` must be supplied with `x` of class 'varest'

what: Plot the Predicted Values of a VAR — ggvar_predict
title: Plot the Predicted Values of a VAR — ggvar_predict
text: Plots result predict.varest call. option overlay true variables, provided test dataset.

title: Plot the Predicted Values of a VAR — ggvar_predict
code: ggvar_predict(   x,   series = NULL,   index_ahead,   index_behind = NULL,   ci = 0.95,   args_line = list(),   args_ribbon = list(fill = NA, linetype = 2, color = "blue"),   args_facet = list(),   ... )

title: Plot the Predicted Values of a VAR — ggvar_predict
text: x "varest" object get predictions . series character vector series (column names) consider. Defaults (NULL). index_ahead vector labels x-axis, normally dates. Applied predicted portion graph. length define prediction horizon. index_behind vector labels x-axis, normally dates. Applied original portion graph. length define 'past' horizon. Leave NULL plot predicted values. ci level confidence prediction confidence interval. Set FALSE omit. Passed predict. args_line Additional arguments passed ggplot2::geom_line. args_ribbon Additional arguments passed ggplot2::geom_ribbon. args_facet Additional arguments passed faceting engine used. ... Arguments passed varr:::predict_setup, generic function formats x 'graphable' format. Use created method unsupported class x.Pass additional arguments stats::predict .

title: Plot the Predicted Values of a VAR — ggvar_predict
text: object class 'ggplot'.

title: Plot the Predicted Values of a VAR — ggvar_predict
code: x <- vars::VAR(freeny[-2]) ggvar_predict(x, NULL, 1:10, 0:-10, args_facet = list(scales = "free_y")) #> Error in test$series(series, x): `series` must inherit one of 'character', 'NULL'

what: Plot Information Criteria for VAR Lag Selection — ggvar_select
title: Plot Information Criteria for VAR Lag Selection — ggvar_select
text: Plots result call VARselect.

title: Plot Information Criteria for VAR Lag Selection — ggvar_select
code: ggvar_select(   x,   series = NULL,   lag.max = 10,   type = "const",   criteria = c("AIC", "HQ", "SC", "FPE"),   trans = "none",   args_line = list(),   ... )

title: Plot Information Criteria for VAR Lag Selection — ggvar_select
text: x dataset (object coercible data.frame) pass VARselect, , directly, result call. series character vector series (column names) consider. Defaults (NULL). lag.max Integer highest lag order. Passed VARselect. type Type deterministic regressors include. Passed VARselect. criteria criteria considered. "AIC", "HQ", "SC", "FPE". trans transformation apply criteria result (vector). Can function, "none" (default), "index" create index numbers. args_line Additional arguments passed ggplot2::geom_line. ... Arguments passed varr:::select_setup, generic function formats x 'graphable' format. Use created method unsupported class x.Pass additional arguments vars::VARselect .

title: Plot Information Criteria for VAR Lag Selection — ggvar_select
text: object class 'ggplot'.

title: Plot Information Criteria for VAR Lag Selection — ggvar_select
code: ggvar_select(vars::VARselect(freeny[-2]))

title: Plot for Structural Stability of a VAR — ggvar_stability
text: x "varest" object pass stability, , directly, "varstabil" object. series character vector series (column names) consider. Defaults (NULL). ci level confidence boundary. args_line Additional arguments passed ggplot2::geom_line. args_hline Additional arguments passed ggplot2::geom_hline. args_facet Additional arguments passed faceting engine used. ... Arguments passed varr:::stability_setup, generic function formats x 'graphable' format. Use created method unsupported class x.Pass additional arguments vars::stability .

title: Plot for Structural Stability of a VAR — ggvar_stability
text: object class 'ggplot'.

title: Plot for Structural Stability of a VAR — ggvar_stability
code: ggvar_stability(vars::VAR(freeny[-2]))

what: Plot Values of Dataset or VAR Residuals — ggvar_values
title: Plot Values of Dataset or VAR Residuals — ggvar_values
text: Plots historic values variables dataset, residuals VAR  model. ggvar_values Plots series facet.  ggvar_values_colored plots graph,  different color.

title: Plot Values of Dataset or VAR Residuals — ggvar_values
code: ggvar_values(   x,   series = NULL,   index = NULL,   args_line = list(),   args_facet = list() )  ggvar_values_colored(   x,   series = NULL,   index = NULL,   colors = NULL,   args_line = list() )

title: Plot Values of Dataset or VAR Residuals — ggvar_values
text: x Either "varest" object plotting residuals, dataset (object coercible data.frame) numeric variables. series character vector variables (column names) consider. Defaults (NULL). index vector labels x-axis, normally dates. Must  length equal x$obs nrow(x). Defaults numeric sequence. args_line Aditional arguments passed geom_line. args_facet Aditional arguments passed facet_wrap. colors vector colors variable. Passed toscale_color_manual. See vignette("colors").

title: Plot Values of Dataset or VAR Residuals — ggvar_values
text: object class ggplot.

title: Plot Values of Dataset or VAR Residuals — ggvar_values
code: ggvar_values(freeny[-2], args_facet = list(scales = "free_y"))  ggvar_values_colored(freeny[-2])  ggvar_values(vars::VAR(freeny[-2]), args_facet = list(scales = "free_y"))

what: varr: Utility Functions for VAR Analisys — varr-package
title: varr: Utility Functions for VAR Analisys — varr-package
text: Functions commonly needed ggplot graphs Vector Auto-Regressive models, like IRF's, FEVD's, predict graphs, VAR residual analysis. Soon contain functions common tests statistics, VAR-like objects.

title: varr (development version)
text: 25/07/2024 - Major refactoring codebase 11/13/2023 - Remade code styling styler lintr, created setup helpers (“setup_ggvar_…”) 11/10/2023 - Added testthat (& vdiffr) basic tests 11/06/2023 - Initial update github (development version, yet tested CRAN suitable)
